documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
Moreover,
in killing the child, one would be killing an innocent person, for the child
has committed no crime, and is not aiming at his mother’s death. And then
there are a variety of ways in which this might be continued. (1) But as di-
rectly killing an innocent person is always and absolutely impermissible, an
abortion may not be performed. Or, (2) as directly killing an innocent person
is murder, and murder is always and absolutely impermissible, an abortion
may not be performed.**Or, (3) a
